org.mindswap.owls.process.variable
Interface ParameterValue

All Superinterfaces:
Visitable<ParameterValueVisitor,ParameterValue>
All Known Subinterfaces:
ValueConstant, ValueForm, ValueFunction<F>, ValueOf
All Known Implementing Classes:
SPARQLValueFunction, ValueConstantImpl, ValueOfImpl
public interface ParameterValue
extends Visitable<ParameterValueVisitor,ParameterValue>

Specification that describes how a ProcessVar is bound to its actual data value. Process variable value specifications are used in bindings. The OWL-S properties valueSource, valueSpecifier, valueData, valueObject, valueForm, and valueFunction are used to link the process variable to its value.

Note that there are no corresponding OWL-S concepts to this interface and the sub interfaces ValueConstant, ValueForm, ValueFunction. Only ValueOf is defined in terms of a OWL concept.

Method Detail

getEnclosingBinding

Binding<?> getEnclosingBinding()
Returns the binding which encloses this parameter value specification.

Returns:
the data binding in which this parameter value is enclosed in

getValueFromPerformResults

OWLValue getValueFromPerformResults(java.util.Map<Perform,ValueMap<ProcessVar,OWLValue>> performsResults)
                                    throws DataFlowException
This method can get used at execution time of some composite process. It gets the actual value from the given perform results map, i.e., binds this parameter to its actual value and returns it.

Parameters:
performsResults - The map containing all parameter-value mappings of preceding performs.
Returns:
The parameter value according to the data flow specification, or the source parameter in case of a self bindings.
Throws:
DataFlowException - In case the value respectively parameter could not be found in the given value map.

setToBinding

void setToBinding(Binding<?> binding)
Sets the value represented by this parameter value specification to the given binding (which should be the enclosing binding).

Parameters:
binding - The binding to which to set the value.
